intro: Salpiglossis albiflora, commonly known as the white lipped morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes other morning glory species. The plant is characterized by its large, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and twining. Salpiglossis albiflora is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil.
